open

public RulesDBAdapter open()
                    throws SQLException
Open the Log database. If it cannot be opened, try to create a new instance of the database. If it cannot be created, throw an exception to signal the failure

Returns:
this (self reference, allowing this to be chained in an initialization call)
Throws:
SQLException - if the database could be neither opened or created

Create a new entry using the body provided. If the entry is successfully created return the new rowId for that entry, otherwise return a -1 to indicate failure.

Parameters:

Returns:
rowId or -1 if failed
